docs.snippet: As global watchdogs warn that euphoric financial markets are divorced from economic reality and acting out some reprise of the credit bubble and bust of the past decade, fears of another subprime timebomb are inevitable.
docs.lead_paragraph: As global watchdogs warn that euphoric financial markets are divorced from economic reality and acting out some reprise of the credit bubble and bust of the past decade, fears of another subprime timebomb are inevitable.

headline.main: Scoping the New Subprime as Watchdogs Cry 'Bubble'
headline.print_headline: Scoping the New Subprime as Watchdogs Cry 'Bubble'

docs.snippet: Some activists like Rebecca Gomperts are now imagining the unthinkable: a future where most abortions happen at home.
docs.lead_paragraph: Some activists like Rebecca Gomperts are now imagining the unthinkable: a future where most abortions happen at home.
docs.abstract: Doctor and activist Rebecca Gomperts, who started support service Women on Web, has designed program based on idea of providing abortions without direct contact with doctor in countries where abortions are illegal or highly restricted; idea is based on medical abortion, in which pills induce miscarriages in first trimester, and is galvanizing abortion activists even in the United States.

headline.main: The Dawn of the Post-Clinic Abortion

docs.snippet: Stepping up his philanthropy, the former mayor of New York still pushes big ideas, but on a much wider stage. Turkey’s smoking rate is just one of his targets.
docs.lead_paragraph: Stepping up his philanthropy, the former mayor of New York still pushes big ideas, but on a much wider stage. Turkey’s smoking rate is just one of his targets.
docs.abstract: Philanthropic ambitions of former New York City mayor Michael Bloomberg have grown to a global scale as he pursues pledge to give away his $32.8 billion fortune before he dies; with programs in 95 countries, Bloomberg Philanthropies has set lofty objectives, like reducing smoking rates in tobacco-loving Turkey among several other initiatives.

docs.snippet: Are superstar architects, who often work in cities they know little about, creating buildings that don't mesh well with the surroundings?
docs.abstract: Are superstar architects, who often work in cities they know little about, creating buildings that don't mesh well with the surroundings?

docs.snippet: The National Archives on Friday unsealed about 1,000 pages of documents from the Clinton administration, the sixth such release in recent months.
docs.abstract: The National Archives on Friday unsealed about 1,000 pages of documents from the Clinton administration, the sixth such release in recent months.

headline.main: New Batch of Clinton-Era Papers Is Released

docs.snippet: At least 3,000 people were arrested in Kenya during four days of security operations across the country following a wave of terror attacks, officials said Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: At least 3,000 people were arrested in Kenya during four days of security operations across the country following a wave of terror attacks, officials said Tuesday.

docs.snippet: President Bill Clinton's advisers carefully considered how to explain the president's military action against Iraq in 1998 as the House was debating his impeachment, according to records from the Clinton White House that were released Friday. The...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Bill Clinton's advisers carefully considered how to explain the president's military action against Iraq in 1998 as the House was debating his impeachment, according to records from the Clinton White House that were released Friday. The documents also touch upon Osama bin Laden, consideration of military action in Haiti in 1994 and preparationsfor Supreme Court nomination hearings.

headline.main: Clinton Papers: Iraq, Bin Laden and Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Clinton Papers: Iraq, Bin Laden and Supreme Court

docs.snippet: John Christy, a highly credentialed professor in Alabama, says warming predictions have been greatly overstated. His critics are many.
docs.lead_paragraph: John Christy, a highly credentialed professor in Alabama, says warming predictions have been greatly overstated. His critics are many.
docs.abstract: John Christy, professor of atmospheric science at University of Alabama in Huntsville, says predictions of global warming have been greatly overstated; though highly credentialed, Christy has many critics.

headline.main: Though Scorned by Colleagues, a Climate-Change Skeptic Is Unbowed
headline.print_headline: Though Scorned by Colleagues, a Climate-Change Skeptic Is Unbowed

docs.snippet: Leaders at a U.S.-Africa summit on energy congratulated and thanked the United States for a new Obama administration proposal to reduce carbon dioxide emissions from power plants, the U.S. secretary of energy said Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Leaders at a U.S.-Africa summit on energy congratulated and thanked the United States for a new Obama administration proposal to reduce carbon dioxide emissions from power plants, the U.S. secretary of energy said Wednesday.

headline.main: US Lauded in Africa for New Coal Emission Proposal
headline.print_headline: US Lauded in Africa for New Coal Emission Proposal

docs.snippet: Kenya's security forces have shot dead five people suspected of involvement in attacks on the coast this week that killed about 65 people, the Interior Ministry said on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Kenya's security forces have shot dead five people suspected of involvement in attacks on the coast this week that killed about 65 people, the Interior Ministry said on Thursday.

headline.main: Kenyan Security Forces Kill Five Coast Attack Suspects
headline.print_headline: Kenyan Security Forces Kill Five Coast Attack Suspects
